data.title: Pennsylvania Renaissance Faire
data.meta_description: Join us yet again for the annual Pennsylvania Renaissance Faire at Mount Hope on the grounds of Mount Hope Estate & Winery! The castle gates swing wide open for mirth and merriment amidst jousting knights and royal delights! A cast of hundreds of colorfully costumed characters fill the Shire with music, dancing, and more! With over 90 stage shows daily, 22 Royal Kitchens and scores of artisan merchants with hand-crafted wares, the Renaissance Faire invites guests to immerse themselves in our 35-acre village and experience the fantasy!
data.text:
Entertainment at PRF

Get ready to live the excitement and adventure of jousting knights and royal delights with colorfully costumed villagers and merrymakers ready to make your visit an unforgettable experience. Musical, stunt and theatrical performances are just a few of the many daily shows! Immerse yourself in the days of Merrie Olde England, steeped in the allure of bygone days and knights! Please check back as we continue to update for the 2024 season! All entertainment is subject to change.

2024 Scenario

Choose. Your. Guild. It's 1589, and England is victorious! The Spanish Armada has been defeated, and the treasure fleet captured. Now, laden with new riches, Queen Elizabeth is making her way to the Shire of Mount Hope for a victory celebration! Intent on investing the spoils of war in her people, Her Most Gracious Majesty will offer Mount Hope's guilds the opportunity to lobby her for a share through a Tournament of Guilds!

Will you support the industrious and shrewd Merchants Guild? The cunning and sly Thieves Guild? Or the dutiful and loyal Civics Guild? Perhaps you fancy yourself a connoisseur of artisan food, beverage, or wares and support the Crafts Guild. On the other hand, you could be a mercurial and merry-making fan of the Revels Guild.

Whichever guild you choose, fly their banners high and wear their colors proudly (Civics' Guild: Green & Copper, Crafts' Guild: Red & Bronze, Merchants' Guild:Blue & Gold, Revels' Guild: Purple & White, Thieves' Guild: Black & Silver). In the process, you can earn them points and help them reap the rewards of the Queen's generosity! Hopefully the competitive spirit remains friendly…

2024 Revels Schedules & Shire Map

Plan your visit with the Revels Schedule and Shire Map. Download the Daily Writ (Schedule & Shire Map) each weekend to learn the where, when and who of your Faire Day visit. Discover the location of the Royal Kitchens, Pour houses, privies and more! Please Note: All Daily Writs are subject to change.

NOW AVAILABLE

#1 • Fairies & Fantasy (August 17 & 18) Daily Writ

#2 • Pyrate Invasion (August 24 & 25) Daily Writ

#3 • Heroes & Villains (August 31 & September 1)

COMING SOON

Follow us on Facebook @PaRenFaire or join the Royal Email List to be the first to know about Daily Writ postings.

#4 • Viking Weekend (September 7 & 8): Daily Writ Coming Soon

#5 • Wizarding Weekend (September 14 & 15): Daily Writ Coming Soon

#6 • Shamrocks & Shenanigans (September 21 & 22): Daily Writ Coming Soon

#7 • Oktoberfest (September 28 & 29): Daily Writ Coming Soon

#8 • Time Travelers (October 5 & 6): Daily Writ Coming Soon

#9 • Halloween Days & Spooky Knights I (October 12 & 13): Daily Writ Coming Soon

#10 • Halloween Days & Spooky Knights II (October 19 & 20): Daily Writ Coming Soon

#11 • Halloween Days & Spooky Knights III (October 26 & 27): Daily Writ Coming Soon

Cast of Characters

The entertainers at the Pennsylvania Renaissance Faire are the main attraction! The full-time, professional Bacchanalian acting company consists of actors, singers and dancers from across the country. The Bacchanalians perform swashbuckling swordplay shows, Shakespearean dramas, interactive improvised scenarios, and rollicking music and dance numbers while portraying Elizabethan characters. The Blackfryar company is comprised of part-time experienced actors, enthusiastic novices with no prior theater experience, college students, senior citizens and everything in between! This cast is primarily responsible for bringing the working Tudor village to life by creating interesting and fun 16th century characters.

Mortimer Pestle

Isaac William Anderson

Bacchanalian

Miller • Thieves'/Crafts' Guild

Retired enforcer, but you'd be surprised how similar milling flour is to cracking skulls.

Rosalind "Rosie" Muck

Allison Bahmer

Bacchanalian

Undertaker • Civics'/Thieves' Guild

Successful entrepreneur and respected Shire citizen, but cross her and it might be your funeral next!

Mallory Livewell

Camille Bechac

Bacchanalian

Barber Surgeon • Civics' Guild

Keeping the shire alive and beautiful. But just because you're alive doesn't mean you Livewell.

Samuel Teagle

Richard Blosser

Blackfryar

Town Crier • Civics' Guild

Sammy-boy knows all the knows that one can know and sees all the sees that one can see. Combine this with a well reunited love of his own voice and you have someone who is darn good at his job.

Nerissa Fitzlocke

Najianna Boone

Blackfryar

Netmaker • Merchants'/Theives' Guild

Did you hear about the one that got away? That's because they weren't using Fitzlocke's Fine Fishing Fibrous Filigrees. For a nominal fee, they can fix that for you.

Faith Bea Liliwhite

Hope Borges

Blackfryar

Washerwoman • Merchants' Guild

Faith is thrilled to have the day off to celebrate Queen Elizabeth's arrival on the shire. Of course, she's made sure that every single member of the shire had clothes that were clean and as bright as her smile before the big day arrived.

Harriet Haddock

Tabitha Borges

Blackfryar

Fishmonger • Merchants' Guild

After some time away from the shire to do some unlicensed deep sea fishing, Harriet is back and boy does she have some whales of tales to tell!

Winston Kirkholm

Pasqualino Borriello

Blackfryar

Junior Alderman • Civics' Guild

This bright eyed young politician is just over the moon about being chosen to be a junior Alderman for the shire. He plans on making the world a better place, one handshake and promise at a time.

Gemma Greaves

Grace Bowmaster

Blackfryar

Armorer • Crafts' Guild

Who says you have to be a giant to be an armorer? Certainly not Gemma Greaves. Her shields are collector's items and her swords could cleave a castle in two. It just goes to prove that size is not all that matters when it comes to weapons!

Rowan O'Rourke

Carl Bright-Walck

Bacchanalian

Minstrel • Revels' Guild

Member of the renowned Celtic Revels. If he's not traveling, he's probably singing about it.

Sir Robert Cecil, Earl of Salisbury

Wybie Buckingham

Blackfryar

Lord (Lord Privy Seal) • Court

Robert Cecil has a razor-sharp wit and an uncanny ability to unravel the most tangled political webs, even at his young age. He can charm the truth out of a stone and his clever quips can bring a smile from even the dourest of duchesses.

Elizabeth Throckmorton

Katherine Campbell Rossi

Blackfryar

Lady-In-Waiting • Court

With a knack for gossip and a love of scandal, Lady Throckie is the darling of the court and the bane of every wrongdoer who doesn't want their particular tale to be told.

Deoiridh Patton

Katie Cannon

Bacchanalian

Ringleader • Revels' Guild

Leader of the renowned Celtic Revels. Doesn't make music for the coin, but it's nice not to starve.

Fox Frye

Madison Caudullo

Bacchanalian

Forager • Merchants'/Thieves' Guild

Plant identifier, nature lover, and expert at surviving the punishing climes of Mount Hope Shire.

Alden Hark

Sahrina Collins

Blackfryar

Yeoman • Court

Alden is a stalwart guardian of the realm, keeping watch over Queen Elizabeth's court with a keen eye. Whether patrolling the palace or chasing after one of the court's wayward hounds, Alden is the epitome of Tudor loyalty and valor.

Xerxes "Zerk" MacAngus

Ty Collins

Bacchanalian

Cook • Revels' Guild

Member of the renowned Celtic Revels. A few slices short of a loaf, but that never stopped anyone from making toast!

Glynis Cael

Katrina Cook

Blackfryar

Vegetable Monger • Merchants' Guild

Psst. Hey! Yeah, you! need a carrot? No? That's fine. Glynnis' got radishes, too. Need a cabbage? She's your girl! Acorn squash? Beet root? You know it. Just, you know, be discreet about it.

Genevieve "Ginny" Grimes

Christina Coulter

Bacchanalian

Rat Catcher • Civics'/Thieves' Guild

In order to catch a rat, you have to think like a rat. Wait, what was the step after that?

Falco Seher

Brendan Courduff

Blackfryar

Yeoman for the Froman • Crafts' Guild

Falco loves his job. What other position in the world allows you to drink on the sundial? No, really, he actually drinks while perched on a sundial. No one knows what time it is, thanks to Falco!

Thomas Fullery

Peter Covington

Blackfryar

Itinerant Actor • Revels' Guild

Thanks to poor stage direction and a hastily thrown together stage near a cliff, Thomas finds himself without an acting company to work with. Not a worry, mount Hope is known to attract all sorts of talent!

Faustina Nardone, Contessa dell'Addizione

Robin Fertitta

Bacchanalian

Medici Mathematician • Court

A representative of the powerful Medici family sent to determine if England is worthy of a place on the world stage.

Temperence Cosmopolite

Angel Fisher

Bacchanalian

Etiquette Mistress • Civics' Guild

Your navigator on the complex seas of social interaction. Always has words of wisdom to guide those in need!

Elizabeth Howard

Amber Freeman

Blackfryar

Lady-In-Waiting • Court

As the eldest Howard daughter, Elizabeth is seen as serious and proper, but she has a wild streak deep down. After hearing her sister's stories of the last progress to Mount Hope, she thinks it's the perfect place to let her hair down. Just don't tell her mother.

Jean Gordon, Countess Bothwell

Elisia Freeman

Blackfryar

Lady-In-Waiting • Court

A dash of wit, a pinch of charm, and a brogue as thick as the Scottish haar (that's fog for the unenlightened among us), Lady Jean brings a bit of the highlands to the English Court.

Gideon Randor

Fritz

Blackfryar

Yeoman • Court

Whether patrolling the palace or accompanying Queen Elizabeth on her progress, Gideon takes their duties seriously. That doesn't mean they can't crack a smile or two. Gideon has been known to share a jest or three with the court and, if others are lucky, they'll get to hear them, too!

Stuart D. Cooke VIII

Giovanni Frontino

Blackfryar

Apprentice Cook • Crafts' Guild

He's Stu Cooke. He cooks stew.

Francis Howard

Kenny Gardner

Blackfryar

Lady-In-Waiting • Court

Frances is delighted to return to Mount Hope to celebrate the victory over the Spanish Armada, especially since her father played a major role. She's ready to have a gay old time again. Mostly gay, she'll leave the old to her sister. And maybe some of the gay. She likes to share

Zephyr Smythe

Sam Gialanella

Blackfryar

Soothsayer • Revels' Guild

So far not a single one of Zephyr's prognostications has come true, but they don't let that bother them because they have seen the future and they know what a success they're going to be. Michel de Nostradame wishes they could have been as accurate as Smythe is going to be…in the future.

Jasper Kisch

Corey Graff

Blackfryar

Goldsmith • Merchants' Guild

With a twinkle in his eye and a hammer in his hand, Jasper is an artist who turns mere metal into treasures fit for the queen. When Jasper opens his workshop doors, even Midas himself becomes green with envy!

Rip

Steve Hager

Blackfryar

Gravedigger • Civics' Guild

He's Rip. What else is there to say? He was here long before any of us. He will be here long after we're all gone.

Pippa Glenfinnan

Delany Hagy

Bacchanalian

Jeweler • Crafts' Guild Leader

Leader of the Crafts Guild and twin sister of Declan Glenfinnan. Older by 5 seconds and well aware of it.

Catherine Howard, Countess Nottingham

Jilly Harris

Blackfryar

Lady-In-Waiting • Court

As one of the queen's closest confidantes and cousin, Catherine is proud of what England has achieved over Spain, especially as her husband is the Lord Admiral. The Lady Admiral is ready to drink and celebrate their victory, if only she can keep her daughters in line.

Dieben Froman

Haley Hartline

Blackfryar

Highwaywoman • Thieves' Guild

With a weapon hidden away and a smirk that could steal the jewels off a noble's neck, Dieben is a rogue of the road, taking from the rich. But today is a festival day, and the queen and her court are not just any nobles, so Dieben is enjoying the day off from stealing from the rich and giving to herself. Back to work tomorrow, though!

Christopher Marlowe

Dom Hernandez

Bacchanalian

Writer • Revels' Guild

Writer, Rapper, Drinker, Spy.

Agatha Weatherwax

Jackie Holzel

Blackfryar

Travelling Storyteller • Revels' Guild

Agatha has a tale for every tavern and a jest for every journey. She can share a story or two because she's seen a thing or two.

Valentina Croftwell

Queen Hunny

Blackfryar

Matchmaker • Revels' Guild

Sometimes you see another person and you just 'know' that they are the one. Valentina has this gift for everyone she meets. Except for herself. That doesn't matter, though. Until she is introduced to the perfect one, she'll continue to enjoy her totally unexamined 100% success rate for others for others.

James Tuttle

Joshua Jacoby

Blackfryar

Leatherworker • Crafts' Guild

James has yet to meet a hide he couldn't handle. There is no bit of skin that is so large or so small that his skillful hands can't fashion it into something useful.

Susan Newgate

Naandi Jamison

Bacchanalian

Street Sweeper • Thieves'/Civics' Guild

Sometimes cleaning up the streets means relocating things that are laying in them. And sometimes the best place for those things is Susan's room.

Thomas Radclyffe, Earl of Sussex

Brad Keller

Blackfryar

Lord Chamberlain • Court

A man of many talents, beloved in many countries, Thomas enjoys a bit of music, a pint, and a story and is more than happy to partake in them all.

Anna Vionnet

Elizabeth Kieser

Blackfryar

Dressmaker • Crafts' Guild

With a needle as swift as her tongue (or is her tongue as swift as her needle?), Anna has a flair for fashion unrivaled in England.

Sable Siskins

Kaedon Knight

Bacchanalian

Furrier • Merchants' Guild

The furriest furrier to fulfill and furnish for all your fur needs forevermore.

Imogen Tumbrel

Karissa Kosman

Bacchanalian

Port Weigher • Merchants'/Thieves' Guild

She's strong, and maybe wrong- when it comes to numbers at least.

Peter Gabbro

Andrew Leubecker

Blackfryar

Stone Mason • Crafts' Guild

It's easy to take for granite, but he has all of his marbles. Or does he?

Renzo Borgogna

Matthew Levy

Bacchanalian

Rag Picker • Thieves'/Civics' Guild

Just a simple peasant with dreams of the big stage… and a suspicious knowledge of the high life.

Artie Fixer

Graham Luker

Bacchanalian

Shire Tinker • Unaffiliated

He's still here, somewhere…and everywhere.

Abigail Sluice

Giavanna Mariano

Bacchanalian

Puddle Drainer • Thieves'/Crafts' Guild

You are cleaning a wet bench with a handkerchief, she is sprinting at you forty miles an hour. You are not the same.

Fiona Follywolle

Kortney Marvel

Blackfryar

Boatswain/Bos'n • Thieves' Guild

Fiona has made quite a name for herself as a ruthlessly efficient deck boss on any crew she's ever worked with. Though, rumor has it that she has a soft spot for turtles.

Duncan Marwood

Sean McCurdy

Blackfryar

Executioner • Civics' Guild

Any day now, Duncan will develop the upper body strength to lift the axed or sword over his head and bring it down with a short sharp shock of finality. Until then, he has devised a clever little scheme of pullies and levers to help him get the job done.

Gwendolin Speck

Audrey Ney

Bacchanalian

Swineherd • Crafts' Guild

The big bad wolf is afraid of her.

Sir Francis Drake

Cole Parker

Bacchanalian

Privateer & Vice Admiral of The Queen's Navy • Court

Hero of the Spanish Armada. You don't have to call him a hero though. He already knows.

Hortenzio Ba'Roque

Isabel Lucio Penn

Bacchanalian

Architect • Merchants' Guild

Rome wasn't built in a day. But that's because they didn't do it his way.

Sir Leonard Carraway

Joe Penn

Bacchanalian

Captain of the Yeoman Guard • Court

Not only a protector of the crown, but also an ear for the people.

Juniper Wistley

Nina Plaksin

Blackfryar

Jester • Court

With bells on their hat and a mischievous grin on their face, Juniper is ready to entertain the queen and her court. Juniper is the life of the party - and wherever they are, it's a party!

Fuller Mugg

Tay Porter

Bacchanalian

Master of Fermentation • Crafts' Guild

Beer, wine, liquor, if it sits around for a while so it can get you drunk, Mugg's got it handled!

Sgt Adora Cringer

Debi Prestine

Blackfryar

Yeoman • Court

Following in her brother's footsteps, Adora Cringer is proud to carry on the family tradition of serving Queen Elizabeth. Halberd in hand, Adora takes her position seriously, and woe unto anyone who tries to get to the queen!

Ford Branson

Collin Purcell

Bacchanalian

Farmer • Thieves'/Merchants' Guild

Whether as a getaway driver or simple farmer, Ford and his horses are outstanding in their field.

Dorothee Crispe

Taylor Rawlinson

Bacchanalian

Interior Decorator • Revels' Guild

Beauty is in the eye of the beholder, but cross her and she'll be holding your eye.

Beau Dredstone

Tyler Reppert

Blackfryar

Yeoman • Court

Beau enjoys swapping tales with other Yeomen of the Guard and with the court. He's the first to lift an ale and the last to call it a night. Beau's love of pranks and jests may make him the closest the yeomen have to a jester!

Carlisle "Kaz" Stonebridge, Esq.

Richie Richardson

Blackfryar

Travelling Salesman/Smuggler • Merchants'/Thieves' Guild

"If you want it, here it is come and get it." Any and all future uses or expansions of that statement shall be credited to Kaz Stonebridge Esq. with royalties to be delivered in turn.

Adam Cringer

James Riley

Blackfryar

Yeoman, Retired • Revels' Guild

While Adam Cringer has turned in his halberd, he still holds court in the local inn and on the lanes of the shire. With countless adventures under his belt, Adam has a tale to tell and now he has the time to share them all!

Douglas Sheffield, Baroness Sheffield

Georgia Rinker

Blackfryar

Lady-In-Waiting • Court

Whether she's trading barbs with a bard or planning her next escapade at the ball, Lady Douglas knows how to turn every event into a spectacle for the ages.

Cornelius Corningstone

Jake Rouse

Bacchanalian

Baker • Thieves's Guild Leader

Used to be the brains of the operation. Still is, but he used to be too.

Caramelle Maillard

Carly Ruchalski

Blackfryar

Candy Thief • Thieves' Guild

Caramelle can make candy disappear faster than fairy floss in the rain. She's the queen of confectionary capers. No candy jar is safe when Caramelle is around!

Effram Buckler

Thomas Russell

Bacchanalian

Blacksmith • Crafts' Guild

Thank the heavens you don't need brains to swing a hammer.

Sir Verence Schtick

Dan Schindlar

Bacchanalian

Master of Revels • Revels' Guild

Making merriment is very serious business to Sir Verrence.

Queen Elizabeth Regina Gloriana

Jules Schrader

Bacchanalian

Queen of England • Court

Queen of all England, Wales and France. Defender of the Faith. Lord of Ireland and the Colony of Virginia in the new world. Victorious.

William Cecil, Lord Burghley

Randy Schulz

Blackfryar

Lord (Lord Treasurer, Poet at Large) • Court

Wielding his quill with elegance, Lord Cecil loves to share his poetry not only with the court but with the people at large. After all, it's not fair to keep such treasures as this confined to only a few. This needs to be shared with the masses.

Penelope Fourthought

Bella Serrano

Blackfryar

Undersheriff • Civics' Guild

Renowned for her ability to track down miscreants faster than you can say "off with their head", Penelope is the shire's answer to law and order.

Roger Kenney

Bryan Smith

Blackfryar

Gambler • Thieves' Guild

Roger is a high-rolling gambler with a smile on his face and a card up his sleeve. With the queen visiting, the stakes are high and Roger's never been happier.

Slip

Jessie Smith

Blackfryar

Powder Monkey • Thieves' Guild

Slip had a full name once, but she's been known as Slip for so long, she's forgotten what it was! With a grin as wide as the horizon and a pouch of gunpowder swinging from her belt, she can climb the rigging faster than anyone and light a cannon faster than you can say "shiver me timbers!"

Prudence "Pru" Meadowlark

Mary Smith

Blackfryar

Tavern Wench • Crafts' Guild

Want to know what's going on in the shire? Well ask someone else, because she didn't overhear anything at the Boarshead while she was working So mind your own business! Unless…

Marino Dominguez Alcantar

José Solis Corps

Blackfryar

Quartermaster • Thieves' Guild

He has heard of this thing called the Armada, but this jovial Spaniard cares for only three things: Good song, Good wine and a tight (and well stocked) ship.

Sir Walter Mildmay

Jacob Soslow

Blackfryar

Lord (Chancellor of the Exchequer) • Court

Lord Mildmay is the dandy of the court, with a penchant for the even finer things in life. He knows how to turn heads and raise eyebrows. When Mildmay is involved, things are sure to get interesting!

Appassionata Penberthy

Emily Sturges

Bacchanalian

Chatelain of the Lady • Civics' Guild Leader

The Lady Mayor's niece. Of the Berwick-upon-Tweed Penberthys.

Seymour Kipper

Valentine Swonger

Blackfryar

Cabin Boy • Thieves' Guild

The poor beleaguered work-horse of their crew. They generally get run so ragged that they don't know their port from their starboard, their bow from their stern or even which boat they're on anymore.

Michelle Claymore

Isabella Szczur

Blackfryar

Sculptor • Revels' Guild

With hands as steady as a rock and a vision as grand as Mount Olympus, Michelle plans on immortalizing everything in stone. From lowest to highest in the land, everyone deserves to have their likeness chiseled from the finest marble England has to offer.

Adamine Sauvage

Jordan Taft

Bacchanalian

Soapmaker • Crafts'/Thieves' Guild

Adamine can get stains out of anything, even your reputation. Who knew making soap could get so dirty?

Janie Heffernan

Grace Taylor

Bacchanalian

Painter • Revels' Guild

Member of the renowned Celtic Revels. Head in the clouds, feet in some good Irish dirt, and friend to all fairies.

Cordelia Gracewood

Robyn Thompson

Blackfryar

Court Dance Mistress • Court

Whether teaching the korobushka or leading the court in a pavane, Mistress Cordelia is the epitome of grace and poise, guiding her charges through the intricate steps of courtly dance with the precision of a master painter and the elegance of a swan on a moonlit lake.

Diana Thorne

Victoria Thompson

Blackfryar

Huntress • Merchants' Guild

Artemis? Herne? Arawn? Ullr? Orion? Nimrod? All of them are rank amateurs compared to the skill of the legendary Diana Thorne . If you've got a week to kill, ask her about her trophy room.

Vanessa Mauthmon

Sandi Trait

Blackfryar

Cryptid Hunter • Civics' Guild

She's seen Scratchy move. She knows Bartleby's first name. She's aware of the dragon who likes to tromp around the woods in other people's shoes. She even painted a few portraits to prove it!

Rory Treadwell

Kirstin Truccano

Blackfryar

Shire Stablemaster • Civics' Guild

Horse. Horsehorse. Horsehorsehorse. Horsehorsehorsehorsehorsehorsehorse. Sleep. Horse.

Meridian "Meri" Brook

Rachel Walker

Blackfryar

Navigator/Cartographer • Merchants'/Thieves' Guild

Meri's assortment of maps has served her well as a navigator, but now that she's back in port, it's time to jettison some of her stock. She'll sell the rarest and most prized from her collection — some of them might even be real!

Declan Glenfinnan

Nick Wasileski

Bacchanalian

Realtor • Merchants' Guild Leader

Leader of the Merchants' Guild and twin brother of Pippa.

Jason Starling

Tyler Wentzel

Blackfryar

Shire Aviary Master • Civics' Guild

Young Starling was originally meant to apprentice to become the lady Mayor's personal falconer. But those birds have sharp beaks and dangerous talons and like to eat things like eyes, so instead he's introduced a kinder gentler kind of birds to the shire.

Analaura Drake, Ryan Esbensen, Devon Finsterbush, Sydny Hansen, Rowan Young

Special Effects Technician

Costume Shop

Costume Designer, Historian

Costume Shop Manager

Lead Stitcher/Wardrobe

Stitchers

Annelise Deppen

Wardrobe

Festival Photographers

Michael Ulrich

PhotographyByMU.com

Michael Adelson

LuriaVisuals.com

2024 Cast Shows

The Shire is bustling with many shows to keep you busy all weekend long! Please refer to each weekends Daily Writ for specific show schedules.

Queen's Court

Join the people of Mount Hope as they greet Queen Elizabeth and her Court and celebrate the defeat of the Spanish Armada! Not only does her Majesty come victorious, but she's brought gifts! The Guild's of Mount Hope are eager to claim their share, but when some sibling rivalry gets in the way, Her Majesty has an idea that will turn the day on its head!

Tournament of Arms

*Loud Noise Notice: Whip Cracking - Mount Hope's Guilds have been competing all day through acts of astounding revelry, but at the Tournament of Arms anything is possible. Cheer on your Guild as they send combatants to fight one another for points. Standings will rise and fall, relationships will be tested, and some Guilds may go to great lengths to ensure victory.

Ultimate Joust

*Loud Noise Notice: Canon Fire, Explosions, Fireworks - Two Guilds stand poised to win it all, and either one's victory rests on the results of a joust TO THE DEATH! Watch as brave knights on horseback test their mettle against each other to satisfy their honor, and to determine the day's victor. Fame, fortune, and life itself are on the line at Bosworth Field!

Finale Pub Sing

*Loud Noise Notice: Possible Whip Cracking - The Tournament of Guilds may be over, but that doesn't mean the revels need to stop! Join the Queen, her court, and all the people of Mount Hope for a final celebration in song, dance, and heaven knows what else—all led by the musicians of the shire! A joyous way to end the day.

Boarshead Brawl

*Loud Noise Notice: Whip Cracking - Old Gibbs has been murdered! With no one able to prove they should be the new owner, the Boar's Head Inn has been shuttered, its tables covered, its tap run dry, and its halls left empty… Or are they? Join us for this action-packed, comedy, stunt, and combat show, to find out what lurks in this ancient establishment, be it man, monster, or something much, much more ridiculous.

English World Wrestling

Mt Hope is honored to once again host the EWW Championship match. Witness lifts, pins, and power moves as caped combatants enter the ring and grapple for the title of English Wrestling World champion!

Whose Jest Is It Anyway?

The wittiest of the shire's citizens gather without the foggiest idea of what they're actually going to do. I guess they'll just have to make it up! Enjoy dazzling displays of improvisation, and see the show that audiences have called "a laugh riot", a "goofy mess" and "a show that's happening right now". Get there fast enough and they may even take your suggestion!

Disasterpiece Theater

There is one place where fine crafts, revels, merchandising, civic responsibility, and lying meet: The Theatre! Join the best actors Mount Hope has to offer (who also happen to be available at 5pm and willing to work for something nebulous known as "exposure") as they produce a new Shakespearean parody of a modern movie or TV show that changes every 2 weeks. To call it a "Masterpiece" may be a stretch… let's just stick with "Disasterpiece".

The Rakish Rogues

*PG-13, Viewer Discretion Advised - Kick back with the Rakish Rogues as they sing bawdy ditties, tell outlandish tales, and take turns sharing their single brain cell. Once a high-paced heist team, these four lovable rascals are (mostly) retired, freshly perspired, and ready to get weird!

The Sirens

*PG-13, Viewer Discretion Advised - It's a dirty job, but someone's got to do it! Even with a busy schedule of suspicious activities, the Sirens are here to bring you a festival day full of keen wit, tight harmonies, and a dash of criminal conspiracy. Just be glad it's their day off.

The Rogues & Sirens Combined Pub Show

*PG-13, Viewer Discretion Advised - Whenever this group of merry miscreants gets together, there's no telling what debauchery may ensue! Grab a pint and enjoy the carnage as the Rogues and Sirens combine for indecorous tunes, irreverent banter, and general shenaniganry.

The Celtic Revels

After a long tour, Mount Hope's very own Celtic Revels are back with a spectacular homecoming show! That is, if they make it to the stage on time… Join the Revels twice a day on a journey through familiar Irish and Scottish favorites with singing, dancing, and maybe even a visit from the Fae Court!

Music with Her Majesty

From energetic ensemble numbers to mysterious secret guests, each Guild has prepared a special piece of tournament revelry to impress the Queen! With plenty of "friendly" competition, come witness this all-out musical battle judged by one of the Shire's premier musicians—Queen Elizabeth herself!

The Messy Puppeteers

The finest puppeteers in all of England have been preparing the perfect performance for Elizabeth's visit to the Shire. Unfortunately, they got sick in Wales. Luckily, three friends found their luggage and are ready to present the finest show they could come up with in the last two days! Antics ensue as three amateurs turn puppetry pros in the Messy Puppeteers!

Trial and Dunke

*PG-13, Viewer Discretion Advised - While the guilds of Mount Hope quarrel, a mysterious society meets under cloak and darkness at the Boar's Head Inn where initiates must be put through secretive tests to be deemed worthy. Will they pass their trial, or will they face the putrid fate that is a dunk in the Boar's Head pool? Also what is this secret society all about? Who even are they? Will there be cake at the meeting? There's only one way to find out…

Bloody Best Shakespeare

*PG-13, Viewer Discretion Advised - Welcome to the monthly meeting of the "Shakespearian Helpers In Theatrical Education". We're glad you could join us for the presentation of four of the bard's beloved works. What these villagers lack in experience, acting chops, and the ability to read they make up for in enthusiasm, and you can be sure they'll give it their bloody best! Now with 75% more blood! Warning: not for the squeamish, or Shakespearean purists.

Off the Cuff

"Off The Cuff" is back and bigger than ever for year two at Mount Hope! Enjoy a show full of high energy improv and musical talent. Catch this merry group sing, flyt and improv their way through your suggestions!

Peasant Dance

On a festival day, it's important that everyone be well-versed in the proper ways of cutting a rug Renaissance-style! The Court Dance Mistress teams up with the shire's high roller to teach you the ways of folk dancing across 3 songs.

Queen's Cavalry

Even on a festive day, the Queen is always searching for nipperkins willing to join her royal cavalry! The shire's Stable Master and Goldsmith have prepared games to test your children's aptitude. If they succeed, they will be sworn in as members of the Queen's Cavalry!

Mount Hope Players Trunk Shows

In order to properly entertain all of Mount Hope's guests, the Master of Revels has seen that members of the Shire prepare entertainments fit for the whole family! Enjoy interactive storytelling perfect for anyone young, young at heart, or just tired and needing a place to sit and be entertained for a while! This year's Trunk Shows are: "The Legend of Black Shuck", and "Loki Liesmith and the Case of the Missing Hammer"!

Barque Scarlett Band

A crew of privateers ashore once more to treat Mount Hope to their favorite sea-songs!

The Rose & Lion Society

Her Majesty's most chordant courtiers — it's a family affair when the Howard siblings get together to make merry with the most notable nobles in the Queen's entourage.

Knaves and Nobles

Both groups of Mount Hope Singers combine for a lesson (in song!) about how the other half lives.

Throck and Buskin

A side-splitting improv show that brings together her majesty's court and the residents of the shire. Turning audience suggestions into uproarious scenes, blending the magic of a festival day with unpredictable hilarity.

Renaissance BINGO

Beano originated in 1530 and is still played today. Join Argyle Douglas each day at the Pyrate Ship, get five in a row and yell BEANO! Prizes given.

Pub Trivia in the Pyrate Ship

Every weekend, join our host for pub trivia that's themed to the weekend! Teams of no more than 4 can compete for nifty prizes, and to prove once and for all the true value of all that useless knowledge you've collected thanks to years of obsession and neuroses.

Faire Day Special Events

Special events below have limited spots and require an additional ticket (visit the Box Office to purchase).

Pub Crawl

Good Beer, Bad Jokes, and Great Stories Hosted by Herr & Frau Froman, The Sausage King & Queen - and Argyle Douglas

Check in for the Pub Crawl begins at 4:30 PM at the Informistress and leaves promptly at 4:45 PM.

Laugh, sing and journey through the Shire on a guided tour to three stops to enjoy a sample of Swashbuckler Brewing Company Beer or Lancaster County Cider with a final stop at O'Malley's to enjoy one last sample paired with saucy entertainment and a salty pretzel.

Pub Crawl Includes: 4 samples, Souvenir Tasting Glass, Soft Pretzel and specialty entertainments. $25 Online Only. Tickets limited. Must be 21+ to participate. Please note: A corresponding date-specific ticket must be purchased for the Pennsylvania Renaissance Faire to enter the Faire grounds and access the Pub Crawl. Both Faire Admission Tickets and Pub Crawl Tickets are date specific, so be sure these dates match. Tickets are non-refundable. Tickets are available via the Box Office.

2024 Royal Performers

The stages of the Pennsylvania Renaissance Faire come to life with scores of unique entertainers, including musicians, magicians, comedy acts, and more! Exact performance times and locations will be available on the Daily Writ upon your arrival to the festival grounds. All entertainment is subject to change.

Aaron Bonk: Fire Whips & Swords

October 12 - 27 • AaronBonk.com

*Loud Noise Notice - Whip Cracking

Aaron Bonk is a 3-time International Performance Champion, 5-time Guinness World Record setting whip artist, and unique entertainer with a twisted sense of humor who risks his life to make you laugh. With stupefying acts of juggling, whip cracking, danger and craziness, he will amuse and amaze the whole family with his world renown stunt show spectacular. Machetes, whips, swords and fire--the hottest show in all the 'Shire!

Adamo Ignis

October 5 - 27 • AdamoIgnis.com

*Loud Noise Notice - Whip Cracking

'Adamo Ignis' is latin for 'to fall in love with flame'. Exactly what you'll be doing when you see the hot stunts in this girl's show! The passion of dance, the danger of fire, and of course many other stunts and tricks will have you jumping out of your seat as she leaps into your heart! Adamo Ignis is one of very few solo female-fronted and run fire and danger shows making her a unique treat for any event.

The Alterra Silks Show

October 5 - 27 • AlterraProductions.com

Incorporating breath-taking drops, elegant choreography, and a captivating personality, Kaitlin will wow you while dancing on aerial silks thirty feet high in the air!

Archery Through the Ages

Full Season

Bringing the history of archery and its world-wide application to life. We demonstrate not only how English long bows and wood arrows are made, but how and why they were such effective tools and weapons of war. Enjoy two Long range demonstrations at 11:30 & 5:30, at the new location by Bosworth Field.

Argyle Douglas

Full Season

Ambassador to England, one of Queen Mary's most trusted advisors, and an emissary for Scottish culture! Don't miss him at "Beano", "Consider Thou This" or "Guts & Glory", as he weaves comedy and storytelling into a cooking demonstration of Scotland's most famous dish, Haggis. This exhibition features an authentic Scottish "plushie" sheep happily providing authentic "plushie" organs thus enabling everyone to savour the experience without any worries about "nasty bits". It is a Scottish Comedy, Culture, & Cooking show. The only show on the shire with the guarantee that, "You will laugh until you stop". It may happen at other shows, but I guarantee it will happen here.

Arthur Greenleaf Holmes*

Aug. 24 - Oct. 27 • ArthurGreenleafHolmes.com

*Adult Content, Not Recommended for Children

Scandalous. Licentious. Madly impolitic…and riotously funny. England's preeminent Poet of the Slop-Pot is back, blending mellifluous language and hypnotic imagery with an utter disregard for decent society. Awarded a Top Ten Best Of 2022 by Theaterscene.org. "Like 75 minutes with the strangest literature professor at a small liberal arts college—the one whose classes always have huge waitlists." --Zachary Stewart, Chief Theater Critic, Theatermania

Barby Holder

October 5 - 27 • BarbyHolder.net

The Hammered Dulcimer Music of Barbary (Barby Holder) will enchant and delight you as you leisurely stroll through the Shire. Whether in the lanes or on a stage, the music will transport you to an earlier time of simplicity and beauty.

The Bastard Monks*

September 7-15 • Like @TheBas.Monks on Facebook

*Adult Content, Not Recommended for Children

A womanizing cad monk and a lonely self-abuser monk travel the land trying to explain God's will with the help of puppets. Please don't bring children to see these bastards.

The Big Rat Show

September 7 - October 13 • ScarlettRat.com

Emrys Fleet's Rat Extravaganza Aka Big Rat Show is a hilarious comedy show featuring Pesky the Wonderous One-eyed Rat and Wilbur the Dancing Weasel. Plenty of jokes and absurdity keep the laughter out loud. He calls it "Comedy Noir"! Rat Puck is a game for Kings and Commoners alike. It is similar the the Scottish "golf" but played with rats and sticks! Join Master of Master's Pucker Emrys Fleet, rat catcher for some instruction and an exhibition round of Rat Puck! Puck We Must!

Buckle & Swash

October 5 - 27 • BuckleAndSwash.com

*Loud Noise Notice - Whip Cracking

Join Captain Red Swash Rogers and Mister Punt Buckle for Pirates, Comedy, Sword Fighting, and other…stuff. Be a part of their outrageous crew in this family-friendly show full of action and laughs! The Buckle and Swash Show: It's attempted murder…but, like, funny!

Burbage & the Bard

October 19 - 27 • Like Burbage & The Bard on Facebook

The legendary playwright Wilhelmina Shakespeare and her greatest actor are here, and there's nothing you can do about it! This silly, singing, sensuous version of the Shakespeare you know and love - and her "close personal friend" Richard Burbage - will have you giggling, snorting, and maybe even singing along! Don't miss the chance to tell your English teacher that you heard Willy Shakes say naughty words with Burbage and The Bard!

The Burly Minstrels

August 24 - October 6 • JimHancock.com

This Power Trio of guitar, double bass, and violin with vocal harmonies energizes the traditional Renaissance Faire repertoire with Burly intent. These three uniquely skilled musicians are out to prove that with music, the total is always greater than the sum of the parts. Come Sing Along!

Celtic Legacy

Full Season • @CelticLegacyColorado on Youtube

World-class bagpipes, earthshaking drums, rockin' guitars, and a mile-a-minute banter only barely scratches the surface of this comedic group of Celtic Lads!

Cirque La Vie

August 17 - 24 • CirqueLaVie.net

*Loud Noise Notice - Possible Whip Cracking

Put together a crazy ringmaster, a strong man, a contortionist, and an acrobat and what do you get? Cirque la vie that's what! Cirque la vie has been one of Texas' favorite and most recognized circus troops since the age of Dragons! Always crazy, fun, spontaneous and predictably unpredictable, our shows are a must see for all!

Cosmo's Fables, Fantasies & Fortunes

August 24 - October 27

Using the SCIENCE of Astrology, Cosmo gives out fortunes, advice, and wisdom According to Cosmo. Throw in improv stories, songs, and very unusual tarot readings, you have a fortune teller like no other.

Demetrius the Minstrel

Full Season

Demetrius can be found performing throughout the Shire (both solo and with friends), as well as with all the Musicians of the Realm for Opening Cannon at the front gate, and the Pub Sing at the end of the Faire day!

Don Juan & Esmeralda

August 17 - September 22 • DonJuanAndMiguel.com

*Loud Noise Notice - Whip Cracking

Join this father daughter duo for a laughter filled adventure while they show off their skills in sword fighting, knife throwing, and whip cracking!

Dora Viellette

September 14 - October 27 • Follow Dora.Viellette on TikTok

Dora Viellette will take you through time with an intriguing array of music on the hurdy gurdy and will happily tell you her favorite music history facts about the instrument and music too! From classics of the Medieval and Renaissance to Celtic and Folk favorites, her blend of sounds and songs will tempt your ears, make you want to stay for a spell, and leave you wanting more.

Edged Feather Experiences

Full Season • Like Edged Feather Experiences on Facebook

Edged Feather Experiences is owned and operated by master class falconer and wildlife educator, Crystal "Cryss" Stacey. Watch these magnificent birds fly through the skies while they demonstrate their natural abilities and aptitude for the ancient sport of falconry. Meet different birds at each performance and get an up-close experience of a lifetime!

Enter the Haggis

Shamrocks & Shenanigans (September 21 - 22) Only • EnterTheHaggis.com

For over two decades, Toronto's Enter The Haggis has combined bagpipes and fiddles with a rock rhythm section to create a distinctively eclectic sound, praised by The Boston Globe, The Washington Post and Canada's Globe and Mail. Their songs offer singalong melodies and deep, meaningful lyrics which tell the stories of everyday hard-working people, often faced with seemingly insurmountable challenges. Signature songs like "One Last Drink", "Gasoline", "Down With The Ship" and "Lancaster Gate" have had millions of plays on streaming services, appeared in Hollywood movies, and have been performed and recorded by artists around the world.

Eric the Viking

Viking Weekend (September 7 - 8) Only

*Loud Noise Notice - Loud Handbells

Eric the Viking, a fearsome warrior with a fiery spirit, brings the heat to the stage with his breathtaking fire juggling and axe-wielding feats. Watch in awe as he spins plates on his sword and helmet horns, juggles flaming torches and battle axes, and even rides a Viking longship while performing daring stunts.

Erik the Everday Viking

Viking Weekend (September 7 - 8) Only • Like Erik the Everday Viking on Facebook

Erik Ormstunga Briansson, I portray a Dane from 950 AD to 1000 AD, I am a re-enactor and educator of Norse culture from that time. I am able to to talks on life style, tools, Nailbinding, luceting, and Norse spiritual ceremonies. I have traveled up and down the east coast of Vinland performing at various venues and museums. I have even performed for the Danish and Norwegian Ambassadors. Even being tested and passed with endorsement by the curator of the Danish museum at an event held at The Philadelphia Franklin Institute. This is my passion and my love it is a pleasure to share with you all.

Fiddlefest

Full Season

Join this fine fiddler for some jaunty Renaissance, Celtic, and Scottish tunes. You can't miss her sparkling skirts and merry melodies as she fiddles her way through the Shire. Beware: you won't be able to stop your toes from tapping or hands from clapping!

Filthy Irish Stories*

August 31 - September 1 • Like Filthy Irish Stories on Facebook

*Adult Content, Not Recommended for Children

A vulgar Irish criminal tells wretched stories, including kidnapping selkies, vengeful crows, insatiable banshees, and the time he nearly died from a fart in a cave.

Hank Woodson

All Season

Shire Sherrif; Who do you call when someone's poisoned the water hole? He'll help as soon as he gets that snake out of his boot.

Harmless Danger Juggling Show

October 5 - 27 • DangerJugglingShow.com

Featuring perilous stunts and outrageous silliness, this unhinged comedy show is more fun than you can shake a baby at!

Hob the Troll

August 24 - October 27 • HobTheTroll.com

Hob began his reign of silly as part of the resident cast at the Michigan Renaissance Festival. Mixing comedy, music, improv, and a flare for the dramatics, he branched out to [mostly planned] appearances at other Renaissance festivals, libraries, vaudeville, and variety shows to critical acclaim.

Jeremy Graeff & Lämning

August 17 - September 22 • JeremyGraeffMusic.com

Medieval and Renaissance world music with a distinctly modern flair.

Kamikaze Fireflies

August 17 - 24 • KamikazeFireflies.com

*Loud Noise Notice - Possible Whip Cracking

Kamikaze Fireflies is a funny, fast paced and firey show that the whole family can enjoy. With five Guinness World Records and a standing ovation on America's Got Talent this two person show is sure to impress with their unique blend of skills such as fire juggling, fire hula hoops, and battling renaissance robots.

Lady Bess of Hardwick

All Season

Lady Bess of Hardwick, a spirited force of nature accompanying Her Majesty on this grand progress, has a twinkle in her eye and a spring in her step. Whether she's discussing courtly manners and matters, or designing her next architectural masterpiece, Lady Bess ensures that the court is filled with laughter — and order!

Lady Grace Note

August 17 - September 29 • MaryGraceAutumn.com

Lady Grace Note will be gracing her presence at the Pennsylvania Renaissance Faire this season on the hammered dulcimer. She will be performing her favorite traditional Celtic and Renaissance tunes around the shire. She is an award-winning hammered dulcimer player, and is a member of the band, Seasons.

The London Broil Show

August 17 - September 22 • Like The London Broil Show on Facebook

Matt, AJ, and Elan perform a show like no other! Part amazing juggling, part Improv Comedy, part generational study in Attention Deficit Disorder, the London Broil Show has what didn't even know you were looking for.

Luke the Cellist

Full Season • Like JustAnotherCello on Facebook

Her Majesty's Cellist can be found throughout the Shire playing a variety of music.

Meet a Unicorn!

August 31 - October 27 • Like Unicorn Hugs on Facebook

Unicorn Hugs creates magic nationwide providing unicorns at festivals and special events. Featuring unicorn handler, Brittany Beard and her performing miniature horse unicorns. Not only are the miniature horses of Unicorn Hugs specially trained therapy horses that go inside children's hospitals nationwide and work hand in hand with Give Kids the World/the Make a Wish foundation, but they are also show horses that love being in the spotlight and have a special temperament for being around kids and adults alike. Experiencing the wonder and getting a photo with these mythical creatures will surely be a memory that you will never forget!

Mirandola Consort

Full Season • RadTrumpet.com

Mirandola Fanfare Trumpets is a Herald trumpet ensemble led by Rob Diener. This group was founded in 1992 by Kevin Rosenbury. The group has performed at Renaissance Fairs and special events all over the country including, a performance withThe Philly Pops Orchestra for the grand oepning of the Kimmel Center in Philadelphia, the Ohio Derby, and the Pocono 500 and Pennsylvania 500 Nascar races. 2019 marks the groups 29th year performing at The Pennsylvania Renaissance Faire.

Nature of Mercy

Full Season • Like Nature of Mercy on Facebook

*Loud Noise Notice - Black Powder Pistol, Whip Cracking

Pirates, Whips and Swords, plus a message of honour in this action packed interactive show for all ages. Follow the adventures of the 'bad but beautiful' Duchess Francesca as she battles Captain Sir Richard Gryphon with swords and wit in this hilarious pirate comedy. Nature of Mercy features the Pyrat Kids Duelling School and gives children a chance to be on stage as heroes of the adventure.

Noble Cause Productions

Full Season • Like Noble Cause on Facebook

Touring across the U. S., but with performing credits all over the world, Noble Cause Productions is a trained theatrical joust troupe. Skilled in lance passes, staged stunt combat, sword, shield, staff and multiple medieval weapons. Noble Cause has been featured on The Travel Channel and Animal Planet.

Paloma Performance Group

Shamrocks & Shenanigans (September 21 - 22) Only • PalomaIrishDance.com

From spirited soft shoe numbers to heart-pounding hard shoe pieces, these dancers will delight and entertain any audience. The Troupe has performed in over 300+ public performances and private events throughout Pennsylvania and Maryland and is comprised of some of the top youth dancers and musicians in North America and the World.

Pastimes

August 17 - 31 • PastimesMusic.Weebly.com

Real olde musicke on real olde instruments by 'rather' olde players.

The Pinwheel Sideshow

August 31 - September 29 • Like Pinwheel Sideshow on Facebook

Pippsy the clown brings the amazing world of sideshow to the stage! Watch in awe as she flirts with death swallowing swords and more! This show has it all — comedy, suspense, puns danger and a drinking game!

The Ploppy Show*

August 17 - 18 & September 21 - October 27 • JenniferEComedy.com • Like Ploppy on Facebook

*Adult Content, Not Recommended for Children

After years of performing in the mud pit, Ploppy Ann Nardsquatter is coming back to the stage. Don't miss one of these risqué, adult comedy shows!

Ploppy. No mud. Still dirty.

Polka Time with Galena Brass

Oktoberfest (September 28 - 29) Only • GalenaBrass.com

The Galena Brass epitomizes "Versatility in Brass." Festivals, Concerts, Private Parties, Parades, Christmas events and Oktoberfest celebrations are just some of the venues you will see the Galena Brass performing at throughout Pennsylvania and New Jersey! Whether they are performing as a roving quartet, or as a 14 piece marching brass band, their performances are always about engaging their audiences and having FUN!

Regale

Full Seaon

Join Harper Lee and Rowan the Bowin' as they share sweet songs and rollicking tunes (and the occasional cover!) on the Celtic harp and cello. Be prepared to be regaled!

Regi Carpenter Storyteller

August 24 - September 8 • RegiCarpenter.com

Regi Carpenter has been touring and telling stories for over 30 years around the world and in people's back yards. A favorite at major festivals throughout the country she is known for humorous and poignant tales that delight people of all ages.

Rover's Way

Full Season • RoversWayMusic.com

Rover's Way invites you on a musical journey. This duo brings together the folk music traditions of many lands with multiple instruments and dynamic harmonies, along with stories behind the music and their adventures on the road. From the toe-tapping tunes of the Newfoundland Coast, to the rousing pub songs of the Emerald Isle, historic tales from the New World, and even a few songs from their own pens.

Roxie's Air Show

August 31 - September 29 • AirSarah.com

Roxie Fireheart is an internationally celebrated aerial acrobat making her dazzling debut at the Pennsylvania Renaissance Faire. Her fearless strength and beauty will set your heart ablaze! Watch as she dances high in the air upon her trapeze! Will she plummet to the Earth only to meet a certain doom? You'll be entranced and amazed by this peerless paramour of perpetual peril! Don't miss the aerial artistry of Roxie Fireheart.

Sausage King & Queen

Full Season • Like @SausageRoyalty on Facebook

*Adult Content, Not Recommended for Children

The escapades of Abraham and Eva Froman, the Sausage King & Queen of the Shire! The Fromans are nouveau riche, and happy to flaunt it. How good is the sausage king's meat? Ask him as he wanders by on his sausage procession, he'll tell you it can't be beat! Eva is the true brains of the operation. Her wurst is her best, and her husband is the best at being the worst. Don't miss "Sausage Court", and be sure to join them during the "Pub Crawl"!

Ship Shape

Viking Weekend (September 7 - 8) Only • Like ShipShapePirates on Facebook

Shiver me timbers, it's Ship Shape! Join us for a music and comedy show complete with side-splitting piratical jests and harmonies so tight that they'll make any landlubber a she shanties fanatic! Let this cook, swabber, and surgeon entertain you while they try to find their land legs — which might have gone down with the ship — and let the mayhem commence! Join Frankie, Swiss, and Mack for a shipload of fun!

Star Shanties

Time Travelers (October 5 - 6) Only • StarShanties.com

Star Shanties: Songs From a Galaxy Far, Far Away premiered at the 2022 Orlando International Fringe Theatre Festival. Inspired by the Star Wars universe, the theatrical production was written and directed by Arthur Rowan (book, music, and lyrics), and co-produced by Arthur Rowan and Ashley Willsey.

Sylvan Farelight

October 5 - 27 • Learn More about Sylvan Farelight

Sylvan Farelight—the honestly dishonest trickster who almost always tells you before he lies and cheats. Join him at his scheduled shows where he cuts off his head for your enjoyment, and find him on the streets of the Shire where he bamboozles one and all with his game of pea and shells.

Trio Mondo

October 5 - 27

Experience the mesmerizing fusion of medieval, Renaissance, Celtic, Eastern European, and original music with Trio Mondo. This world music trio takes you on a musical journey where vibrant melodies and spontaneous jams create a delightful sonic tapestry.

2024 Royal Kitchens

Her Majesty's Kitchens cook up an endless array of savory 16th century foods and delicious traditional favorites sure to satisfy the heartiest of appetites.

All menus are subject to change without notice. No outside food, beverages or coolers are permitted to be brought onto the faire grounds, with the exception of Guests with special dietary needs that have completed and presented the Visitor Allergen Card to the Customer Service Window at the front gate—Learn more on the FAQ page. All PRF Food Booths and Pour Houses accept cash only. ATMs are available on site.

2024 PRF Pourhouses

Wash down the delicious Royal Kitchen cuisine with refreshing hand-made Swashbuckler Brewing Co. Ales, Mount Hope Wines, Lancaster County Ciders and Spirits Distilling Co. Signature Cocktails! Enjoy them throughout the festival grounds, then stop by the Mount Hope Wine Shop or Swashbuckler Brewery when you leave to take your new favorites home with you!

All menus are subject to change without notice. All PRF Royal Kitchens are cash only. ACT 39 of the PLCB allows a PA Limited Winery (LK) to sell liquor produced by a PA limited distillery for on-premises consumption. [47 P.S. Â§ 4469a)(2)]. More Information.
